info.title: Schemas
info.description: The CRM uses schemas to define how custom objects should store and represent information in the HubSpot CRM. Schemas define details about an object's type, properties, and associations. The schema can be uniquely identified by its **object type ID**.
info.x-hubspot-api-use-case: Create a new object for storing information about cars at a car dealership. Your object definition could include properties to store information as well as the filters available on the custom object index page.
info.x-hubspot-introduction: Use the custom objects schema API to define new types of CRM records in your account. After setting up an object schema, you'll then be able to create records for that custom object both in HubSpot and using the objects API.

primaryDisplayProperty.description: The name of the primary property for this object. This will be displayed as primary on the HubSpot record page for this object type.

requiredProperties.description: The names of properties that should be **required** when creating an object of this type.

searchableProperties.description: Names of properties that will be indexed for this object type in by HubSpot's product search.

secondaryDisplayProperties.description: The names of secondary properties for this object. These will be displayed as secondary on the HubSpot record page for this object type.

ObjectTypeDefinitionPatch.description: Defines attributes to update on an object type.

createdAt.description: When the object type was created.

id.description: A unique ID for this object type. Will be defined as {meta-type}-{unique ID}.

name.description: A unique name for this object. For internal use only.

portalId.description: The ID of the account that this object type is specific to.

primaryDisplayProperty.description: The name of the primary property for this object. This will be displayed as primary on the HubSpot record page for this object type.

requiredProperties.description: The names of properties that should be **required** when creating an object of this type.

searchableProperties.description: Names of properties that will be indexed for this object type in by HubSpot's product search.

secondaryDisplayProperties.description: The names of secondary properties for this object. These will be displayed as secondary on the HubSpot record page for this object type.

updatedAt.description: When the object type was last updated.

displayOrder.description: Options are shown in order starting with the lowest positive integer value. Values of -1 will cause the option to be displayed after any positive values.

hidden.description: Hidden options won't be shown in HubSpot.

label.description: A human-readable option label that will be shown in HubSpot.

value.description: The internal value of the option, which must be used when setting the property value through the API.

correlationId.description: A unique identifier for the request. Include this value with any error reports or support tickets

links.description: A map of link names to associated URIs containing documentation about the error or recommended remediation steps

message.description: A human readable message describing the error along with remediation steps where appropriate

subCategory.description: A specific category that contains more specific detail about the error

example.message: Invalid input (details will vary based on the error)

code.description: The status code associated with the error detail

in.description: The name of the field or parameter in which the error was found.

message.description: A human readable message describing the error along with remediation steps where appropriate

subCategory.description: A specific category that contains more specific detail about the error

description.description: A description of the property that will be shown as help text in HubSpot.

displayOrder.description: Options are shown in order starting with the lowest positive integer value. Values of -1 will cause the option to be displayed after any positive values.

fieldType.description: Controls how the property appears in HubSpot.

formField.description: Whether the property can be used in a HubSpot form.

groupName.description: The name of the group this property belongs to.

hasUniqueValue.description: Whether or not the property's value must be unique. Once set, this can't be changed.

hidden.description: Hidden options won't be shown in HubSpot.

label.description: A human-readable option label that will be shown in HubSpot.

name.description: A unique name for this object. For internal use only.

numberDisplayHint.description: Controls how numeric properties are formatted in the HubSpot UI

optionSortStrategy.description: Controls how the property options will be sorted in the HubSpot UI.

options.description: A list of available options for the property. This field is only required for enumerated properties.

referencedObjectType.description: Defines the options this property will return, e.g. OWNER would return name of users on the portal.

searchableInGlobalSearch.description: Allow users to search for information entered to this field (limited to 3 properties)

showCurrencySymbol.description: Whether the property will display the currency symbol in the HubSpot UI.

textDisplayHint.description: Controls how text properties are formatted in the HubSpot UI

type.description: The data type of the property.

fromObjectTypeId.description: ID of the primary object type to link from.

name.description: A unique name for this object. For internal use only.

toObjectTypeId.description: ID of the target object type ID to link to.

properties.description: Properties defined for this object type.

ObjectSchema.description: Defines an object schema, including its properties and associations.

associatedObjects.description: Associations defined for this object type.

name.description: A unique name for this object. For internal use only.

primaryDisplayProperty.description: The name of the primary property for this object. This will be displayed as primary on the HubSpot record page for this object type.

properties.description: Properties defined for this object type.

requiredProperties.description: The names of properties that should be **required** when creating an object of this type.

searchableProperties.description: Names of properties that will be indexed for this object type in by HubSpot's product search.

ObjectSchemaEgg.description: Defines a new object type, its properties, and associations.

plural.description: The word for multiple objects. (There’s no way to change this later.)

singular.description: The word for one object. (There’s no way to change this later.)

ObjectTypeDefinitionLabels.description: Singular and plural labels for the object. Used in CRM display.

displayOrder.description: Options are shown in order starting with the lowest positive integer value. Values of -1 will cause the option to be displayed after any positive values.

hidden.description: Hidden options won't be shown in HubSpot.

label.description: A human-readable option label that will be shown in HubSpot.

value.description: The internal value of the option, which must be used when setting the property value through the API.

Option.description: The options available when a property is an enumeration

archived.description: Whether or not the property is archived.

calculated.description: For default properties, true indicates that the property is calculated by a HubSpot process. It has no effect for custom properties.

calculationFormula.description: The formula used for calculated properties.

createdAt.description: When the object type was created.

createdUserId.description: The internal ID of the user who created the property in HubSpot. This field may not exist if the property was created outside of HubSpot.

dataSensitivity.description: Indicates the sensitivity level of the property, such as "non_sensitive", "sensitive", or "highly_sensitive".

description.description: A description of the property that will be shown as help text in HubSpot.

displayOrder.description: Options are shown in order starting with the lowest positive integer value. Values of -1 will cause the option to be displayed after any positive values.

externalOptions.description: For default properties, true indicates that the options are stored externally to the property settings.

fieldType.description: Controls how the property appears in HubSpot.

formField.description: Whether the property can be used in a HubSpot form.

groupName.description: The name of the group this property belongs to.

hasUniqueValue.description: Whether or not the property's value must be unique. Once set, this can't be changed.

hidden.description: Hidden options won't be shown in HubSpot.

hubspotDefined.description: This will be true for default object properties built into HubSpot.

label.description: A human-readable option label that will be shown in HubSpot.

name.description: A unique name for this object. For internal use only.

options.description: A list of available options for the property. This field is only required for enumerated properties.

referencedObjectType.description: Defines the options this property will return, e.g. OWNER would return name of users on the portal.

sensitiveDataCategories.description: When sensitiveData is true, lists the type of sensitive data contained in the property (e.g., "HIPAA").

showCurrencySymbol.description: Whether the property will display the currency symbol in the HubSpot UI.

type.description: The data type of the property.

updatedAt.description: When the object type was last updated.

updatedUserId.description: The internal user ID of the user who updated the property in HubSpot. This field may not exist if the property was updated outside of HubSpot.
